summary:
I am an experienced public company and Government executive, advisor, diplomat and director, who specializes in leading people through change.

I have done this across many sectors including: the military and police forces; aviation; education; health; manufacturing; professional services; and engineering/construction; and in the Regions of 
Australasia; the Middle East; South Asia; North Africa; and now Europe.

Throughout my 30+ year career I've been able to successfully lead organizational change whatever the cause eg. mergers & acquisitions, restructuring, or leadership change. The goals have been to optimize growth, reduce overheads and other costs, improve and digitalize processes, and thereby strengthen overall performance including health and safety, employee and stakeholder engagement, employer branding, and profitability.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for providing commercial advice to growing New Zealand companies in the Netherlands and championing some pretty cool, exciting and important projects for NZTE in Europe. 

I really enjoy working with our clients to help them grow their businesses and achieve their goals. It's always a great feeling when we can help a client succeed in exporting to the Netherlands and Europe !

I'm also involved in supporting the implementation of the NZ-EU Free Trade Agreement for NZ entities. It's definitely a challenging task, but it's also incredibly rewarding to know that we're making a real difference and helping to facilitate international trade between New Zealand and Europe.
profile_positions.title: Advisor - Commercial & Special Projects - Netherlands & Europe

profile_positions.description:
The role had 2 components:
The first was being New Zealand's senior representative in Dubai and the 5 other northern emirates in the UAE.  This meant representing NZ at Ministerial and Governmental meetings, and being a spokesperson for NZ at various events and forums. 
The second was leading 18 Trade and Commercial Advisors over my 6 years in the role providing advice and support to grow the 150+ New Zealand companies operating in the Region.

Key achievements included:
• Consistently exceeding commercial deal  value KPIs which were between $40-70m per annum. 
• Leading the Expo2020 Business Leverage Programme which yielded 50 commercial deals valued at an impressive $62.9M over the 6 months.
• Spearheading major deliverables for some of the biggest events in the region, including Gulfood, Big5 Construction, Gulfood Manufacturing, and ArabHealth. These events are critical for connecting New Zealand companies with potential customers and partners in the region.
profile_positions.title: NZ Consul General Dubai and Trade Commissioner (UAE, Qatar, the Levant countries, Africa and Iran)

profile_positions.description:
As NZTE's acting Regional Director for India, Middle East and Africa (IMEA), I was responsible for achieving commercial KPIs, ensuring customer satisfaction, engaging and motivating my 30+ Regional team, and overseeing large-scale event planning and programme development across South Asia, the Middle East, and Africa.

Throughout my time in this role, I was also able to cultivate strong relationships with stakeholders and various New Zealand agencies to strategically coordinate Ministerial visits throughout the UAE. It was an incredibly fulfilling experience to work towards expanding New Zealand's presence in this part of the world.

profile_positions.description:
At PwC I had been in the Transaction Services team that supported the Transfield Services owners to acquire Areva and Alstrom in New Zealand. The new Transfield Services CEO, Graeme Sumner, then asked me to come on-board in this role to help him and his new team, bring these acquired companies together with the existing Transfield businesses in NZ.  

We had all the usual acquisition challenges of bringing different cultures and operating processes together and getting them aligned. It meant getting closer to our Australian colleagues to get that broader alignment across the Group.

I led the HR, Quality and HSE teams across the Group with the initial aim to get the alignment and then engagement in the agreed company protocols particularly safety which a paramount focus for us given the nature of the business.
profile_positions.title: General Manager Human Resources, Quality, Environmental, Health & Safety

profile_positions.description:
Once the Management Consulting Service Line had left PwC, the managing partners realised that the Firm needed capability in the people aspects of M&A, restructuring, and search. I was asked to lead the establishment of this practice area in the NZ Firm by the Chairman, John Shewan and Managing Partner Warwick Hunt.

Some of the key assignments were:
* Restructuring of Te Wananga O Aotearoa ( NZ's largest tertiary education body)
* Performance optimisation of NZ Police's Communication Centres
* Review of NZ Customs Audit function
* Managerial due diligence for ANZ Bank Private Equity 
* HR Function Due Diligence of several large NZ organisations eg. Inland Revenue
* People Audits for M&A Due Diligences including Transfield Services, Areva, Alstom
profile_positions.title: Director of People & Change Consulting

profile_positions.description:
I was headhunted for this role. It was shortly after the amalgamation of Pricewaterhouse and Coopers & Lybrand. Initially I was the HR Director for the Audit/Assurance serviceline which included Transaction Services and Private Clients, but then a year later I picked up Tax, Legal and Advisory service lines once Management Consulting was sold to IBM.

I managed a large HR team across these Service Lines and across the many offices in New Zealand at the time. I was also part of the Australia-NZ HR Leadership team so visited PwC Australia regularly.
profile_positions.title: HR Director - Audit, Tax and Business Advisory

profile_positions.description:
I was initially promoted into a role leading a large project called Service 21 to modernize the Employment Terms and Conditions of the 3 arms of the uniformed New Zealand Defence Force (NZDF) ie. Army, Navy, and Air Force.  The aim of this project which was achieved,  was to increase the retention of military personnel given the declining tenure of uniformed personnel in the 1980s and 1990s.

For my work leading this project I was made a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit (MNZM) in 1999 by the NZ Government and Queen Elizabeth II as Head of State.
profile_positions.title: Director of Strategic Human Resources
